page.title: 01Location of Whitburn
page.content:
Whitburn is a large village on the North East coast.It lies between the towns of Sunderland and South Shields. Sunderland,on the River Wear was once a well known ship building area, but is now in decline. South Shields at the mouth of the River Tyne guards the entrance to a still busy quay.
Shore and Coast Line.
Whitburn Village is at the northern end of the natural curve of Whitburn Bay.The cliffs are sandstone and limestone and are rapidly eroding.At the base of the cliffs lies a good sandy beach and jutting out into the sea are two flat,rocky outcrops known locally as the White Steel and the Black Steel.The tide can be dangerous as it comes in a pincer movement and cuts off the rocks from the mainland.
